meanings.definition: A person who is timid or easily scared.
meanings.sent1: The playground bullies always picked on the wussies who never stood up for themselves.
meanings.sent2: Don't be wussies, just face your fears and try something new!
meanings.sent3: The wussies in the horror movie were too scared to even walk through the haunted house.
meanings.sent4: In the jungle of life, the wussies are the ones who get left behind.
meanings.sent5: The image of the wussies trembling in fear will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: Plural form of 'wussy', meaning a weak or cowardly person.
meanings.sent1: The team lost the game because they were a bunch of wussies who couldn't handle the pressure.
meanings.sent2: The wussies in the group always backed out of challenges at the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The wussies at the costume party all dressed as superheroes to hide their true cowardly selves.
meanings.sent4: When faced with a difficult decision, the wussies took the easy way out every time.
meanings.sent5: The battlefield was filled with the echoes of the wussies' cries as they retreated in fear.
